table:columns.name: aws0_5
table:columns.description: Available water storage estimate (AWS) in a standard zone 1 (0-5 cm depth), expressed in mm. The volume of plant available water that the soil can store in this layer based on all map unit components (weighted average). NULL values are presented where data are incomplete or not available.

table:columns.name: aws5_20
table:columns.description: Available water storage estimate (AWS) in standard layer 2 (5-20 cm depth), expressed in mm. The volume of plant available water that the soil can store in this layer based on all map unit components (weighted average). NULL values are presented where data are incomplete or not available.

table:columns.name: aws20_50

The volume of plant available water that the soil can store in this layer based on all map unit components (weighted average). NULL values are presented where data are incomplete or not available.

table:columns.name: aws50_100
table:columns.description: Available water storage estimate (AWS) in standard layer 3 (50-100 cm depth), expressed in mm. The volume of plant available water that the soil can store in this layer based on all map unit components (weighted average). NULL values are presented where data are incomplete or not available.

table:columns.name: aws100_150
table:columns.description: Available water storage estimate (AWS) in standard layer 5 (100-150 cm depth), expressed in mm. The volume of plant available water that the soil can store in this layer based on all map unit components (weighted average). NULL values are presented where data are incomplete or not available.

table:columns.name: aws150_999
table:columns.description: Available water storage estimate (AWS) in standard layer 6 (150 cm to the reported depth of the soil profile), expressed in mm. The volume of plant available water that the soil can store in this layer based on all map unit components (weighted average). NULL values are presented where data are incomplete or not available.

table:columns.description: Available water storage estimate (AWS) in standard zone 2 (0-20 cm depth), expressed in mm. The volume of plant available water that the soil can store in this zone based on all map unit components (weighted average). NULL values are presented where data are incomplete or not available.

table:columns.description: Available water storage estimate (AWS) in standard zone 3 (0-30 cm depth), expressed in mm. The volume of plant available water that the soil can store in this zone based on all map unit components (weighted average). NULL values are presented where data are incomplete or not available.

table:columns.description: Available water storage estimate (AWS) in standard zone 4 (0-100 cm depth), expressed in mm. The volume of plant available water that the soil can store in this zone based on all map unit components (weighted average). NULL values are presented where data are incomplete or not available.

table:columns.name: aws0_150
table:columns.description: Available water storage estimate (AWS) in standard zone 5 (0-150 cm depth), expressed in mm. The volume of plant available water that the soil can store in this zone based on all map unit components (weighted average). NULL values are presented where data are incomplete or not available.

table:columns.name: aws0_999

The volume of plant available water that the soil can store in this layer based on all map unit components (weighted average). NULL values are presented where data are incomplete or not available.

table:columns.name: tk0_5a
table:columns.description: Thickness of soil components used in standard layer 1 or standard zone 1 (0-5 cm) expressed in cm (weighted average) for the available water storage calculation. NULL values are presented where data are incomplete or not available.

table:columns.name: tk5_20a
table:columns.description: Thickness of soil components used in standard layer 2 (5-20 cm) expressed in cm (weighted average) for the available water storage calculation. NULL values are presented where data are incomplete or not available.

table:columns.name: tk20_50a
table:columns.description: Thickness of soil components used in standard layer 3 (20-50 cm) expressed in cm (weighted average) for the available water storage calculation. NULL values are presented where data are incomplete or not available.

table:columns.name: tk50_100a
table:columns.description: Thickness of soil components used in standard layer 4 (50-100 cm) expressed in cm (weighted average) for the available water storage calculation. NULL values are presented where data are incomplete or not available.

table:columns.name: tk100_150a
table:columns.description: Thickness of soil components used in standard layer 5 (100-150 cm) expressed in cm (weighted average) for the available water storage calculation. NULL values are presented where data are incomplete or not available.

table:columns.name: tk150_999a
table:columns.description: Thickness of soil components used in standard layer 6 (150 cm to the reported depth of the soil profile) expressed in cm (weighted average) for the available water storage calculation. NULL values are presented where data are incomplete or not available.

table:columns.name: tk0_20a
table:columns.description: Thickness of soil components used in standard zone 2 (0-20 cm) expressed in cm (weighted average) for the available water storage calculation. NULL values are presented where data are incomplete or not available.

table:columns.name: tk0_30a
table:columns.description: Thickness of soil components used in standard zone 3 (0-30 cm) expressed in cm (weighted average) for the available water storage calculation. NULL values are presented where data are incomplete or not available.

table:columns.name: tk0_100a
table:columns.description: Thickness of soil components used in standard zone 4 (0-100 cm) expressed in cm (weighted average) for the available water storage calculation. NULL values are presented where data are incomplete or not available.

table:columns.name: tk0_150a
table:columns.description: Thickness of soil components used in standard zone 5 (0-150 cm) expressed in cm (weighted average) for the available water storage calculation. NULL values are presented where data are incomplete or not available.

table:columns.name: tk0_999a
table:columns.description: Thickness of soil components used in total soil profile (0 cm to the reported depth of the soil profile) expressed in cm (weighted average) for the available water storage calculation. NULL values are presented where data are incomplete or not available.

table:columns.name: musumcpcta
table:columns.description: The sum of the comppct_r (SSURGO component table) values used in the available water storage calculation for the map unit. Useful metadata information. NULL values are presented where data are incomplete or not available.

table:columns.name: soc0_5
table:columns.description: Soil organic carbon stock estimate (SOC) in standard layer 1 or standard zone 1 (0-5 cm depth). The concentration of organic carbon present in the soil expressed in grams C per square meter to a depth of 5 cm. NULL values are presented where data are incomplete or not available.

table:columns.name: soc5_20
table:columns.description: Soil organic carbon stock estimate (SOC) in standard layer 2 (5-20 cm depth). The concentration of organic carbon present in the soil expressed in grams C per square meter for the 5-20 cm layer. NULL values are presented where data are incomplete or not available.

table:columns.name: soc20_50
table:columns.description: Soil organic carbon stock estimate (SOC) in standard layer 3 (20-50 cm depth). The concentration of organic carbon present in the soil expressed in grams C per square meter for the 20-50 cm layer. NULL values are presented where data are incomplete or not available.

table:columns.name: soc50_100
table:columns.description: Soil organic carbon stock estimate (SOC) in standard layer 4 (50-100 cm depth). The concentration of organic carbon present in the soil expressed in grams C per square meter for the 50-100 cm layer. NULL values are presented where data are incomplete or not available.

table:columns.name: soc100_150
table:columns.description: Soil organic carbon stock estimate (SOC) in standard layer 5 (100-150 cm depth). The concentration of organic carbon present in the soil expressed in grams C per square meter for the 100-150 cm layer. NULL values are presented where data are incomplete or not available.

table:columns.name: soc150_999
table:columns.description: Soil organic carbon stock estimate (SOC) in standard layer 6 (150 cm to the reported depth of the soil profile). The concentration of organic carbon present in the soil expressed in grams C per square meter for the 150 cm and greater depth layer. NULL values are presented where data are incomplete or not available.

table:columns.name: soc0_20
table:columns.description: Soil organic carbon stock estimate (SOC) in standard zone 2 (0-20 cm depth). The concentration of organic carbon present in the soil expressed in grams C per square meter to a depth of 20 cm. NULL values are presented where data are incomplete or not available.

table:columns.name: soc0_30
table:columns.description: Soil organic carbon stock estimate (SOC) in standard zone 3 (0-30 cm depth). The concentration of organic carbon present in the soil expressed in grams C per square meter to a depth of 30 cm. NULL values are presented where data are incomplete or not available.

table:columns.name: soc0_100
table:columns.description: Soil organic carbon stock estimate (SOC) in standard zone 4 (0-100 cm depth). The concentration of organic carbon present in the soil expressed in grams C per square meter to a depth of 100 cm. NULL values are presented where data are incomplete or not available.

table:columns.name: soc0_150
table:columns.description: Soil organic carbon stock estimate (SOC) in standard zone 5 (0-150 cm depth). The concentration of organic carbon present in the soil expressed in grams C per square meter to a depth of 150 cm. NULL values are presented where data are incomplete or not available.

table:columns.name: soc0_999
table:columns.description: Soil organic carbon stock estimate (SOC) in total soil profile (0 cm to the reported depth of the soil profile). The concentration of organic carbon present in the soil expressed in grams C per square meter for the total reported soil profile depth. NULL values are presented where data are incomplete or not available.

table:columns.name: tk0_5s
table:columns.description: Thickness of soil components used in standard layer 1 or standard zone 1 (0-5 cm) expressed in cm (weighted average) for the Soil Organic Carbon calculation. NULL values are presented where data are incomplete or not available.

table:columns.name: tk5_20s
table:columns.description: Thickness of soil components used in standard layer 2 (5-20 cm) expressed in cm (weighted average) for the Soil Organic Carbon calculation. NULL values are presented where data are incomplete or not available.

table:columns.name: tk20_50s
table:columns.description: Thickness of soil components used in standard layer 3 (20-50 cm) expressed in cm (weighted average) for the Soil Organic Carbon calculation. NULL values are presented where data are incomplete or not available.

table:columns.name: tk50_100s
table:columns.description: Thickness of soil components used in standard layer 4 (50-100 cm) expressed in cm (weighted average) for the Soil Organic Carbon calculation. NULL values are presented where data are incomplete or not available.

table:columns.name: tk100_150s
table:columns.description: Thickness of soil components used in standard layer 5 (100-150 cm) expressed in cm (weighted average) for the Soil Organic Carbon calculation. NULL values are presented where data are incomplete or not available.

table:columns.name: tk150_999s
table:columns.description: Thickness of soil components used in standard layer 6 (150 cm to the reported depth of the soil profile) expressed in cm (weighted average) for the Soil Organic Carbon calculation. NULL values are presented where data are incomplete or not available.

table:columns.name: tk0_20s
table:columns.description: Thickness of soil components used in standard zone 2 (0-20 cm) expressed in cm (weighted average) for the Soil Organic Carbon calculation. NULL values are presented where data are incomplete or not available.

table:columns.name: tk0_30s
table:columns.description: Thickness of soil components used in standard zone 3 (0-30 cm) expressed in cm (weighted average) for the Soil Organic Carbon calculation. NULL values are presented where data are incomplete or not available.

table:columns.name: tk0_100s
table:columns.description: Thickness of soil components used in standard zone 4 (0-100 cm) expressed in cm (weighted average) for the Soil Organic Carbon calculation. NULL values are presented where data are incomplete or not available.

table:columns.name: tk0_150s
table:columns.description: Thickness of soil components used in standard zone 5 (0-150 cm) expressed in cm (weighted average) for the Soil Organic Carbon calculation. NULL values are presented where data are incomplete or not available.

table:columns.name: tk0_999s
table:columns.description: Thickness of soil components used in total soil profile (0 cm to the reported depth of the soil profile) expressed in cm (weighted average) for the Soil Organic Carbon calculation. NULL values are presented where data are incomplete or not available.

table:columns.name: musumcpcts
table:columns.description: The sum of the comppct_r (SSURGO component table) values used in the soil organic carbon calculation for the map unit. Useful metadata information. NULL values are presented where data are incomplete or not available.

table:columns.name: nccpi3corn
table:columns.description: National Commodity Crop Productivity Index for Corn (weighted average) for major earthy components. Values range from .01 (low productivity) to .99 (high productivity). Earthy components are those soil series or higher level taxa components that can support crop growth (Dobos et al., 2012). Major components are those soil components where the majorcompflag = 'Yes' (SSURGO component table). NULL values are presented where data are incomplete or not available.

table:columns.name: nccpi3soy
table:columns.description: National Commodity Crop Productivity Index for Soybeans (weighted average) for major earthy components. Values range from .01 (low productivity) to .99 (high productivity). Earthy components are those soil series or higher level taxa components that can support crop growth (Dobos et al., 2012). Major components are those soil components where the majorcompflag = 'Yes' (SSURGO component table). NULL values are presented where data are incomplete or not available.

table:columns.name: nccpi3cot
table:columns.description: National Commodity Crop Productivity Index for Cotton (weighted average) for major earthy components. Values range from .01 (low productivity) to .99 (high productivity). Earthy components are those soil series or higher level taxa components that can support crop growth (Dobos et al., 2012). Major components are those soil components where the majorcompflag = 'Yes' (SSURGO component table). NULL values are presented where data are incomplete or not available.

table:columns.name: nccpi3sg
table:columns.description: National Commodity Crop Productivity Index for Small Grains (weighted average) for major earthy components. Values range from .01 (low productivity) to .99 (high productivity). Earthy components are those soil series or higher level taxa components that can support crop growth (Dobos et al., 2012). Major components are those soil components where the majorcompflag = 'Yes' (SSURGO component table). NULL values are presented where data are incomplete or not available.

table:columns.name: nccpi3all
table:columns.description: National Commodity Crop Productivity Index that has the highest value among Corn and Soybeans, Small Grains, or Cotton (weighted average) for major earthy components. Values range from .01 (low productivity) to .99 (high productivity). Earthy components are those soil series or higher level taxa components that can support crop growth (Dobos et al., 2012). Major components are those soil components where the majorcompflag = 'Yes' (SSURGO component table). NULL values are presented where data are incomplete or not available.

table:columns.name: pctearthmc
table:columns.description: The National Commodity Crop Productivity Index map unit percent earthy is the map unit summed comppct_r for major earthy components. Earthy components are those soil series or higher level taxa components that can support crop growth (Dobos et al., 2012). Major components are those soil components where the majorcompflag = 'Yes' (SSURGO component table). Useful metadata information. NULL values are presented where data are incomplete or not available.

table:columns.name: rootznemc
table:columns.description: Root zone depth is the depth within the soil profile that commodity crop (cc) roots can effectively extract water and nutrients for growth. Root zone depth influences soil productivity significantly. Soil component horizon criteria for root-limiting depth include: presence of hard bedrock, soft bedrock, a fragipan, a duripan, sulfuric material, a dense layer, a layer having a pH of less than 3.5, or a layer having an electrical conductivity of more than 12 within the component soil profile. If no root-restricting zone is identified, a depth of 150 cm is used to approximate the root zone depth (Dobos et al., 2012). Root zone depth is computed for all map unit major earthy components (weighted average). Earthy components are those soil series or higher level taxa components that can support crop growth (Dobos et al., 2012). Major components are those soil components where the majorcompflag = 'Yes' (SSURGO component table). NULL values are presented where data are incomplete or not available.

table:columns.name: rootznaws
table:columns.description: Root zone (commodity crop) available water storage estimate (RZAWS) , expressed in mm, is the volume of plant available water that the soil can store within the root zone based on all map unit earthy major components (weighted average). Earthy components are those soil series or higher level taxa components that can support crop growth (Dobos et al., 2012). Major components are those soil components where the majorcompflag = 'Yes' (SSURGO component table). NULL values are presented where data are incomplete or not available.

table:columns.name: droughty
table:columns.description: zone for commodity crops that is less than or equal to 6 inches (152 mm) expressed as "1" for a drought vulnerable soil landscape map unit or "0" for a non-droughty soil landscape map unit or NULL for miscellaneous areas (includes water bodies) or where data were not available. It is computed as a weighted average for major earthy components. Earthy components are those soil series or higher level taxa components that can support crop growth (Dobos et al., 2012). Major components are those soil components where the majorcompflag = 'Yes'

table:columns.name: pwsl1pomu
table:columns.description: Potential Wetland Soil Landscapes (PWSL) is expressed as the percentage of the map unit that meets the PWSL criteria. The hydric rating (soil component variable “hydricrating”) is an indicator of wet soils. For version 1 (pwsl1), those soil components that meet the following criteria are tagged as PWSL and their comppct_r values are summed for each map unit. Soil components with hydricrating = 'YES' are considered PWSL. Soil components with hydricrating = “NO” are not PWSL. Soil components with hydricrating = 'UNRANKED' are tested using other attributes, and will be considered PWSL if any of the following conditions are met: drainagecl = 'Poorly drained' or 'Very poorly drained' or the localphase or the otherph data fields contain any of the phrases "drained" or "undrained" or "channeled" or "protected" or "ponded" or "flooded". If these criteria do not determine the PWSL for a component and hydricrating = 'UNRANKED', then the map unit will be classified as PWSL if the map unit name contains any of the phrases "drained" or "undrained" or "channeled" or "protected" or "ponded" or "flooded". For version 1 (pwsl1), waterbodies are identified as "999" when map unit names match a list of terms that identify water or intermittent water or map units have a sum of the comppct_r for "Water" that is 80% or greater. NULL values are presented where data are incomplete or not available.

table:columns.name: musumcpct
table:columns.description: The sum of the comppct_r (SSURGO component table) values for all listed components in the map unit. Useful metadata information. NULL values are presented where data are incomplete or not available.

table:columns.name: mukey
table:columns.description: Map unit key is the unique identifier of a record in the Mapunit table. Use this column to join the Component table to the Mapunit table and the valu1 table to the MapUnitRaster_10m raster map layer to map valu1 themes.

table:columns.name: areasymbol
table:columns.description: A symbol that uniquely identifies a single occurrence of a particular type of area (e.g. Lancaster Co., Nebraska is NE109).

table:columns.name: interpname
table:columns.description: The connotative name of an interpretation.

table:columns.name: interptype
table:columns.description: Indicates if the corresponding interpretation is designed as a limitation, suitability or class.

table:columns.name: interpdesc
table:columns.description: A narrative text description of the logic used to generate an interpretation.

table:columns.name: interpdesigndate
table:columns.description: The date and time that the logic of an interpretation was last modified.

table:columns.name: interpgendate
table:columns.description: The date and time that the corresponding interpretive results for this interpretation were generated.

table:columns.name: interpmaxreasons
table:columns.description: The maximum number of reasons reported for the corresponding soil interpretation.

table:columns.name: sacatalogkey
table:columns.description: A non-connotative string of characters used to uniquely identify a record in the Survey Area Catalog table.

table:columns.name: sainterpkey
table:columns.description: A non-connotative string of characters used to uniquely identify a record in the Survey Area Interpretation table.

table:columns.name: areasymbol
table:columns.description: A symbol that uniquely identifies a single occurrence of a particular type of area (e.g. Lancaster Co., Nebraska is NE109).

table:columns.name: areaname
table:columns.description: The name given to the specified geographic area.

table:columns.name: saversion
table:columns.description: A sequential integer number used to denote the overall serial version of the data (tabular and/or spatial) for a soil survey area.

table:columns.name: saverest
table:columns.description: The date and time that a particular version of data (tabular and/or spatial) for the soil survey area was established.

table:columns.name: tabularversion
table:columns.description: A sequential integer number used to denote the serial version of the tabular data for a soil survey area.

table:columns.name: tabularverest
table:columns.description: The date and time that a particular version of tabular data for the soil survey area was established.

table:columns.name: tabnasisexportdate
table:columns.description: The date and time that soil survey area tabular data was exported from NASIS.

table:columns.name: tabcertstatus
table:columns.description: The level of certification assigned to a tabular data package for a particular soil survey area.

table:columns.name: tabcertstatusdesc
table:columns.description: Narrative text notes (metadata) associated with the assignment of the tabular data certification status for a particular soil survey area.

table:columns.name: fgdcmetadata
table:columns.description: The FGDC (Federal Geographic Data Committee) spatial and/or tabular metadata for the corresponding soil survey area, in XML format.

table:columns.name: sacatalogkey
table:columns.description: A non-connotative string of characters used to uniquely identify a record in the Survey Area Catalog table.

table:columns.name: recdate
table:columns.description: The date associated with a particular record, expressed as month, day, year -- xx/xx/xxxx.

table:columns.name: mapunittextkind
table:columns.description: Text kind provides a grouping of text entries according to their subject matter.  For example, the text kind "edit notes" groups text entries that deal with adding or changing data.

table:columns.name: textcat
table:columns.description: A text entry is identified by its kind, category, and subcategory.  Category is a subdivision of kind.  "Agr" and "Soi" are two categories for the text kind "Nontechnical Description".

table:columns.name: textsubcat
table:columns.description: A text entry is identified by its kind, category, and subcategory.  Subcategory is a subdivision of category.  For text kind "Nontechnical" description and text category "Agr", subcategory would correspond to the SSSD field "desnum".

table:columns.name: text
table:columns.description: The actual narrative text portion of a text entry.  The other parts of a text entry are its identifiers: kind, category and subcategory.

table:columns.name: mukey
table:columns.description: The unique identifier of a record in the Mapunit table.  Use this column to join the Mapunit Text table to the Mapunit table.

table:columns.name: mutextkey
table:columns.description: A non-connotative string of characters used to uniquely identify a record in the Mapunit Text table.

table:columns.name: cropname
table:columns.description: The common name for the crop.

table:columns.name: yldunits
table:columns.description: Crop yield units per unit area for the specified crop.

table:columns.name: nonirryield_l
table:columns.description: The expected yield per acre of the specific crop without supplemental irrigation.

table:columns.name: nonirryield_r
table:columns.description: The expected yield per acre of the specific crop without supplemental irrigation.

table:columns.name: nonirryield_h
table:columns.description: The expected yield per acre of the specific crop without supplemental irrigation.

table:columns.name: irryield_l
table:columns.description: The expected yield per acre of the specific crop with irrigation.

table:columns.name: irryield_r
table:columns.description: The expected yield per acre of the specific crop with irrigation.

table:columns.name: irryield_h
table:columns.description: The expected yield per acre of the specific crop with irrigation.

table:columns.name: mukey
table:columns.description: The unique identifier of a record in the Mapunit table.  Use this column to join the Mapunit Crop Yield table to the Mapunit table.

table:columns.name: mucrpyldkey
table:columns.description: A non-connotative string of characters used to uniquely identify a record in the Mapunit Crop Yield table.

table:columns.name: areaovacres
table:columns.description: The extent, in acres, of the map unit within the geographic area referenced in the Legend Area Overlap table.

table:columns.name: lareaovkey
table:columns.description: The unique identifier of a record in the Legend Area Overlap Table.  Use this column to join the Mapunit Area Overlap table to the Legend Area Overlap table.

table:columns.name: mukey
table:columns.description: The unique identifier of a record in the Mapunit table.  Use this column to join the Mapunit Area Overlap table to the Mapunit table.

table:columns.name: muareaovkey
table:columns.description: A non-connotative string of characters used to uniquely identify a record in the Mapunit Area Overlap table.

table:columns.name: musym
table:columns.description: The symbol used to uniquely identify the soil mapunit in the soil survey.

table:columns.name: muname
table:columns.description: Correlated name of the mapunit (recommended name or field name for surveys in progress).

table:columns.name: mustatus
table:columns.description: Identifies the current status of the map unit.\r\n\r\nAs of SSURGO version 2.1, values for this attribute are no longer provided.  This attribute will be dropped from the next major SSURGO version.

table:columns.name: slopegraddcp
table:columns.description: The difference is elevation between two points, expressed as a percentage of the distance between those points.  This column displays the slope gradient of the dominant component of the map unit based on composition percentage.

table:columns.name: slopegradwta
table:columns.description: The difference is elevation between two points, expressed as a percentage of the distance between those points.  This column displays the weighted average slope gradient of all components in the map unit.

table:columns.name: brockdepmin
table:columns.description: The distance from the soil surface to the top of a bedrock layer, expressed as a shallowest depth of components whose composition in the map unit is equal to or exceeds 15%.

table:columns.name: wtdepannmin
table:columns.description: The shallowest depth to a wet soil layer (water table) at any time during the year expressed as centimeters from the soil surface, for components whose composition in the map unit is equal to or exceeds 15%.

table:columns.name: wtdepaprjunmin
table:columns.description: The shallowest depth to a wet soil layer (water table) during the months of April through June expressed in centimeters from the soil surface for components whose composition in the map unit is equal to or exceeds 15%.

table:columns.name: flodfreqdcd
table:columns.description: The annual probability of a flood event expressed as a class. This column displays the dominant flood frequency class for the map unit, based on composition percentage of map unit components whose composition in the map unit is equal to or exceeds 15%.

table:columns.name: flodfreqmax
table:columns.description: The annual probability of a flood event expressed as a class.  This column displays the highest probability class assigned to an individual component of the map unit whose composition in the map unit is equal to or exceeds 15%.

table:columns.name: pondfreqprs
table:columns.description: The percentage of the map unit that is subject to water being ponded on the soil surface, expressed as one of four classes; 0-14%, 15-49%, 50-74% or 75-100%.

table:columns.name: aws025wta
table:columns.description: Available water storage (AWS).  The volume of water that the soil, to a depth of 25 centimeters, can store that is available to plants.  It is reported as the weighted average of all components in the map unit, and is expressed as centimeters of water.\r\n\r\nAWS is calculated from AWC (available water capacity) which is commonly estimated as the difference between the water contents at 1/10 or 1/3 bar (field capacity) and 15 bars (permanent wilting point) tension, and adjusted for salinity and fragments.

table:columns.name: aws050wta
table:columns.description: Available water storage (AWS).  The volume of water that the soil, to a depth of 50 centimeters, can store that is available to plants.  It is reported as the weighted average of all components in the map unit, and is expressed as centimeters of water.\r\n\r\nAWS is calculated from AWC (available water capacity) which is commonly estimated as the difference between the water contents at 1/10 or 1/3 bar (field capacity) and 15 bars (permanent wilting point) tension, and adjusted for salinity and fragments.

table:columns.name: aws0100wta
table:columns.description: Available water storage (AWS).  The volume of water that the soil, to a depth of 100 centimeters, can store that is available to plants.  It is reported as the weighted average of all components in the map unit, and is expressed as centimeters of water.\r\n\r\nAWS is calculated from AWC (available water capacity) which is commonly estimated as the difference between the water contents at 1/10 or 1/3 bar (field capacity) and 15 bars (permanent wilting point) tension, and adjusted for salinity and fragments.

table:columns.name: aws0150wta
table:columns.description: Available water storage (AWS).  The volume of water that the soil, to a depth of 150 centimeters, can store that is available to plants.  It is reported as the weighted average of all components in the map unit, and is expressed as centimeters of water.\r\n\r\nAWS is calculated from AWC (available water capacity) which is commonly estimated as the difference between the water contents at 1/10 or 1/3 bar (field capacity) and 15 bars (permanent wilting point) tension, and adjusted for salinity and fragments.

table:columns.name: drclassdcd
table:columns.description: The natural drainage condition of the soil refers to the frequency and duration of wet periods.  This column displays the dominant drainage class for the map unit, based on composition percentage of each map unit component.

table:columns.name: drclasswettest
table:columns.description: The natural drainage condition of the soil refers to the frequency and duration of wet periods.  This column displays the wettest drainage class assigned to an individual component of the map unit whose composition in the map unit is equal to or exceeds 15%.

table:columns.name: hydgrpdcd
table:columns.description: Hydrologic Group is a grouping of soils that have similar runoff potential under similar storm and cover conditions. This column displays the dominant hydrologic group for the map unit, based on composition percentage of each map unit component.

table:columns.name: iccdcd
table:columns.description: The broadest category in the land capability classification system for soils.   This column displays the dominant capability class, under irrigated conditions, for the map unit based on composition percentage of all components in the map unit.

table:columns.name: iccdcdpct
table:columns.description: The percent composition of the map unit that has the capability class displayed in the Irrigated Capability Class

table:columns.name: niccdcd
table:columns.description: The broadest category in the land capability classification system for soils.   This column displays the dominant capability class, under non-irrigated conditions, for the map unit based on composition percentage of all components in the map unit.

table:columns.name: niccdcdpct
table:columns.description: The percent composition of the map unit that has the capability class displayed in the Non-Irrigated Capability Class  - Dominant Condition column.

table:columns.name: engdwobdcd
table:columns.description: The rating of the map unit as a site for dwellings without basements, expressed as the dominant rating class for the map unit, based on composition percentage of each map unit component.

table:columns.name: engdwbdcd
table:columns.description: The rating of the map unit as a site for dwellings with basements, expressed as the dominant rating class for the map unit, based on composition percentage of each map unit component.

table:columns.name: engdwbll
table:columns.description: The rating of the map unit as a site for dwellings with basements, expressed as the least limiting rating class for the map unit, based on the evaluation of each component in the map unit.

table:columns.name: engdwbml
table:columns.description: The rating of the map unit as a site for dwellings with basements, expressed as the most limiting rating class for the map unit, based on the evaluation of each component in the map unit.

table:columns.name: engstafdcd
table:columns.description: The rating of the map unit as a site for septic tank absorption fields, expressed as the dominant rating class for the map unit, based on composition percentage of each map unit component.

table:columns.name: engstafll
table:columns.description: The rating of the map unit as a site for septic tank absorption fields, expressed as the least limiting rating class for the map unit, based on the evaluation of each component in the map unit.

table:columns.name: engstafml
table:columns.description: The rating of the map unit as a site for septic tank absorption fields, expressed as the most limiting rating class for the map unit, based on the evaluation of each component in the map unit.

table:columns.name: engsldcd
table:columns.description: The rating of the map unit as a site for sewage lagoons, expressed as the dominant rating class for the map unit, based on composition percentage of each map unit component.

table:columns.name: engsldcp
table:columns.description: The rating of the map unit as a site for sewage lagoons, expressed as the rating class for the dominant component in the map unit, based on composition percentage of each map unit component.

table:columns.name: englrsdcd
table:columns.description: The rating of the map unit as a site for local roads and streets, expressed as the dominant rating class for the map unit, based on composition percentage of each map unit component.

table:columns.name: engcmssdcd
table:columns.description: The rating of the map unit as a source of sand, expressed as the dominant class for the map unit, based on composition percentage of each map unit component.

table:columns.name: engcmssmp
table:columns.description: The rating of the map unit as a source of sand, expressed as the most probable class for the map unit, based on the evaluation of each component whose composition in the map unit is equal to or exceeds 15%.

table:columns.name: urbrecptdcd
table:columns.description: The rating of the map unit as a site for paths and trails, expressed as the dominant rating class for the map unit, based on composition percentage of each map unit component.

table:columns.name: urbrecptwta
table:columns.description: The relative rating of the map unit for use as paths and trails, expressed as a weighted average of numerical ratings for individual soil components in the map unit.  The ratings are on a scale of 0.0 to 1.0, with the higher values indicating more limitations.

table:columns.name: forpehrtdcp
table:columns.description: The relative potential erosion hazard for the map unit when used as a site for forest roads and trails, expressed as the rating class for the dominant component in the map unit, based on composition percentage of each map unit component.

table:columns.name: hydclprs
table:columns.description: An indication of the proportion of the map unit, expressed as a class, that is "hydric", based on the hydric classification of individual map unit components.

table:columns.name: awmmfpwwta
table:columns.description: The relative rating of the map unit for use as a disposal site of Manure and Food Processing Wastes, expressed as a weighted average of numerical ratings for individual components in the map unit.  The ratings are on a scale of 0.0 to 1.0, with the higher values indicating increasing limitations.

table:columns.name: mukey
table:columns.description: The unique identifier of a record in the Mapunit table. It also serves as the non-connotative string of characters used to uniquely identify a record in the Mapunit Aggregated Attribute table as there is a one-to-one relationship between records in these two tables.  Use this column to join the Mapunit Aggregated Attribute table to the Mapunit table.

table:columns.name: musym
table:columns.description: The symbol used to uniquely identify the soil mapunit in the soil survey.

table:columns.name: muname
table:columns.description: Correlated name of the mapunit (recommended name or field name for surveys in progress).

table:columns.name: mukind
table:columns.description: Code identifying the kind of mapunit.  Example: C - consociation.

table:columns.name: mustatus
table:columns.description: Identifies the current status of the map unit.\r\n\r\nAs of SSURGO version 2.1, values for this attribute are no longer provided.  This attribute will be dropped from the next major SSURGO version.

table:columns.name: muacres
table:columns.description: The number of acres of a particular map unit within the geographic area to which the legend applies.  The number listed here may differ from that measured using GIS software due to different measuring techniques and rounding practices, or due to the fact that the value has been adjusted so that the sum total of all map units in the legend equals that listed for soil survey area.

table:columns.name: mapunitlfw_l
table:columns.description: The approximate width of a particular map unit delineation represented by a linear soil feature on a soil map.

table:columns.name: mapunitlfw_r
table:columns.description: The approximate width of a particular map unit delineation represented by a linear soil feature on a soil map.

table:columns.name: mapunitlfw_h
table:columns.description: The approximate width of a particular map unit delineation represented by a linear soil feature on a soil map.

table:columns.name: mapunitpfa_l
table:columns.description: The approximate area of a particular map unit delineation represented by a point feature on a soil map.

table:columns.name: mapunitpfa_r
table:columns.description: The approximate area of a particular map unit delineation represented by a point feature on a soil map.

table:columns.name: mapunitpfa_h
table:columns.description: The approximate area of a particular map unit delineation represented by a point feature on a soil map.

table:columns.name: farmlndcl
table:columns.description: Identification of map units as prime farmland, farmland of statewide importance, or farmland of local importance.

table:columns.name: muhelcl
table:columns.description: The overall Highly Erodible Lands (HEL) classification for the mapunit based on the rating of its components for wind and water HEL classification.

table:columns.name: muwathelcl
table:columns.description: The Highly Erodible Lands (HEL) classification for the mapunit based on the rating of its components for water HEL classification.

table:columns.name: muwndhelcl
table:columns.description: The Highly Erodible Lands (HEL) classification for the mapunit based on the rating of its components for wind HEL classification.

table:columns.name: interpfocus
table:columns.description: The targeted landuse for which the Map Unit was developed.  The properties of included mapunit components are tailored towards this landuse.

table:columns.name: invesintens
table:columns.description: The level of detail and relative intensity of field observation under which the map unit was developed.  Order 1 indicates the highest intensity, and order 5 the lowest.

table:columns.name: iacornsr
table:columns.description: Corn Suitability Rating (CSR) is an index procedure developed in Iowa to rate each different kind of soil for its row-crop productivity.

table:columns.name: nhiforsoigrp
table:columns.description: Interpretative class for the map unit, based on NH developed interpretations.

table:columns.name: nhspiagr
table:columns.description: New Hampshire Soil Potential Index for Agriculture, 1992 revision.  Used for computation of weighted average SPI on a parcel of land for adjustment of current use land assessment.

table:columns.name: vtsepticsyscl
table:columns.description: The interpretive separations, or class, based on the ability of the map unit to support an onsite septic system. (Ancillary Soil Interpretation Ratings For On-site Sewerage Disposal in Vermont)

table:columns.name: mucertstat
table:columns.description: The level of certification assigned to a map unit.  Intended to indicate whether or not the map unit should be used and the degree of confidence with which it may be used.\r\n\r\nAs of SSURGO version 2.1, values for this attribute are no longer provided.  This attribute will be dropped from the next major SSURGO version.

table:columns.name: lkey
table:columns.description: The unique identifier of a record in the Legend table.  Use this column to join the Mapunit table to the Legend table.

table:columns.name: mukey
table:columns.description: A non-connotative string of characters used to uniquely identify a record in the Mapunit table.

table:columns.name: recdate
table:columns.description: The date associated with a particular record, expressed as month, day, year -- xx/xx/xxxx.

table:columns.name: legendtextkind
table:columns.description: A text entry can be identified by its kind, category, and subcategory.  Kind is the highest division of classification.  Text kind provides a grouping of text entries according to their subject matter.

table:columns.name: textcat
table:columns.description: A text entry is identified by its kind, category, and subcategory.  Category is a subdivision of kind.  "Agr" and "Soi" are two categories for the text kind "Nontechnical Description".

table:columns.name: textsubcat
table:columns.description: A text entry is identified by its kind, category, and subcategory.  Subcategory is a subdivision of category.  For text kind "Nontechnical" description and text category "Agr", subcategory would correspond to the SSSD field "desnum".

table:columns.name: text
table:columns.description: The actual narrative text portion of a text entry.  The other parts of a text entry are its identifiers: kind, category and subcategory.

table:columns.name: lkey
table:columns.description: The unique identifier of a record in the Legend table.  Use this column to join the Legend Text table to the Legend table.

table:columns.name: legtextkey
table:columns.description: A non-connotative string of characters used to uniquely identify a record in the Legend Text table.

table:columns.name: areatypename
table:columns.description: The name of a particular type of geographic area to which the legend applies.  Examples include "Non-MLRA Soil Survey Area" and "MLRA Soil Survey Area".

table:columns.name: areasymbol
table:columns.description: The identifying symbol given to the specified geographic area to which the legend applies.

table:columns.name: areaname
table:columns.description: The name given to the specified geographic area to which the legend applies.

table:columns.name: areaacres
table:columns.description: The acreage total of all land and water areas in the specified geographic area to which the legend applies.  The number listed here is used for administrative purposes and may differ from that measured using GIS software, or other techniques, due to fact that it was assigned to agree with the acreage listed in the NRCS Natural Resource Inventory for the geographic area.

table:columns.name: mlraoffice
table:columns.description: An NRCS business unit responsible for oversight of soil survey production activities of a particular soil survey area.

table:columns.name: legenddesc
table:columns.description: A short text field used to describe a particular soil survey area legend.

table:columns.name: ssastatus
table:columns.description: Identifies the operational activity of a soil survey area and currency of published soil information.  Examples are Non-Project, Update and Published.\r\n\r\nAs of SSURGO version 2.1, values for this attribute are no longer provided.  This attribute will be dropped from the next major SSURGO version.

table:columns.name: mouagncyresp
table:columns.description: The lead agency designated as responsible for a particular soil survey.

table:columns.name: projectscale
table:columns.description: The map scale in which the final map products will be published, expressed as the denominator of the scale, i.e. 24000 = 1:24000.

table:columns.name: cordate
table:columns.description: The date the final correlation document for a soil survey is signed, expressed as month, year (e.g. 07/1999).

table:columns.name: ssurgoarchived
table:columns.description: The date on which the SSURGO product for a particular soil survey is actually archived, expressed as month, day, year -- xx/xx/xxxx.

table:columns.name: legendsuituse
table:columns.description: Identifies the relative geographic extent over which a legend has the most up-to-date soil survey data.\r\n\r\nAs of SSURGO version 2.1, values for this attribute are no longer provided.  This attribute will be dropped from the next major SSURGO version.

table:columns.name: legendcertstat
table:columns.description: The level of certification assigned to a legend.  Intended to indicate whether or not the legend should be used and the degree of confidence with which it may be used.\r\n\r\nAs of SSURGO version 2.1, values for this attribute are no longer provided.  This attribute will be dropped from the next major SSURGO version.

table:columns.name: lkey
table:columns.description: A non-connotative string of characters used to uniquely identify a record in the Legend table.
